intro: Calamus pacificus, commonly known as the Pacific screw-pine, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Pandanaceae. It is a shrub-like plant that typically grows in coastal and brackish water environments. The plant has long, narrow leaves that are often used in traditional crafts and as a source of fiber. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in the axils of the leaves. Calamus pacificus is adapted to saline conditions and is often found in mangrove swamps and tidal flats.
